question: What are two ways to determine a probability that are mentioned in Section 2.1?

answers.answer: Estimate it using simulation
answers.feedback: Correct. Using simulations to estimate probabilities is one of the fundamental techniques used in this book.

answers.answer: Guess the value
answers.feedback: Incorrect. This technique is not reliable and not mentioned in this section.

answers.answer: Determine the probability using mathematical analysis
answers.feedback: Correct. This is another technique that will be introduced in this book.

answers.answer: Ask ChatGPT
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Although this may work in some instances, values returned by ChatGPT are not necessarily reliable, and hence this technique is not mentioned in this section.

question: If you calculate that the probability of something occurring is very close to (but less than) 1, then:

answers.answer: That thing is almost certain to occur
answers.feedback: Correct.

answers.answer: That thing is very unlikely to occur
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Things that are unlikely to occur have probabilities close to zero.

answers.answer: You must have made a mistake
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Probabilities that are close to, but less than, 1 are valid probabilities. Thus, there is not reason that this must have been a mistake.

question: Which of these are listed as reasons to use simulations instead of experiments?

answers.answer: Experiments would require a lot of time
answers.feedback: Correct.

answers.answer: Experiments would require a lot of resources
answers.feedback: Correct.

answers.answer: The experiment cannot be repeated in real life
answers.feedback: Correct.

answers.answer: The experiment does not accurately model the system
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Generally experiments include the true system, whereas simulations are just an approximation of that system.

question: Which of the following is true of histograms

answers.answer: Can only be used with discrete data
answers.feedback: False. Histograms bin data together, and this allows it to be used with continuous data

answers.answer: Can only be used with continuous data
answers.feedback: False. Histograms can be used to count discrete data, either with one value per bin or multiple values per bin
